bibRefCitation.refString: Muir, F. (1913) On some new species of leaf-hoppers. Part II. Derbidae. Hawaiian Sugar Planters Association, Division of Entomology, Bulletin, No. 12, 28 - 90.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dichotropis amboinensis Muir, 1913: 84
, plate I, Fig. 20 , plate III Fig.6

Decora vettius Fennah, 1970: 65
, Figs. 69–74 syn. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Redescription. Forewings 1.9 times longer than wide, length: male 3.8–5.1 mm (mean = 4.6, n= 11), female 3.9– 4.4 mm (mean = 4.1, n= 8). Colour stramineous to light brown, some specimens tinted with green; margins of facial carinae, rostrum, middle of pronotum and tibiae may be tinted with orange. Forewings white, powdered; a black mark, of variable shape, near hind margin distad of clavus; apical cross-veins may be lined with infuscation. Facial carinae well separated; subantennal processes and lateral carinae of pronotum well developed; antennae small, ellipsoid, just reaching lower margin of eyes; rostrum reaching abdomen. Forewings with Sc+R fork near or just before its middle; Ms1a touching Cu1. Male genitalia with two long lateral processes on anal segment. Genital styles truncated apically; proximal dorsal process small, its pointed tip curved inwards; base of distal dorsal process wide, nearly rectangular, apical part turned outwards; at the inside near the base a finger-like process bearing bristles at the tip. Apical part of aedeagus elongated, flat, at the apex extended on the left side; on the right side bearing two small dorsal lobes.

Etymology .
Derived from Amboina (the old name for the Indonesian island of Ambon ), the latinized species name (
amboinensis , -ensis, -ense
) is an adjective.

Type material .
Dichotropis amboinensis
, lectotype ♂ (designated by Zelazny 1981: 263 ) (forewing 3.8 mm ), INDONESIA : Ambon Isl.; labels: 1) Amboina/ F. Muir 2) TYPE OF / Dichotropis 3) TYPE OF / D. amboinensis / Muir 4) Decora / amboinensis/ Kirk. 5) 589 ( BPBM #5149).
Decora vettius
, holotype , ♂ (forewing 4.5 mm ), PAPUA NEW GUINEA ; labels: 1) Papua: Kokoda, 1,200 ft. viii 1933 . L.E. Cheesman. B.M. 1933-427 ( BMNH ).

Note .
Muir described this species from 4 specimens , a male and a female from Ambon
I. ( Indonesia ), a male from Larat I. ( Indonesia , near Tanimbar ) and a female from Laloki (apparently near Port Moresby in Papua and New Guinea). The BPBM contains only the ♂ from Ambon
.

Distribution .
Philippine Isl. ( Zelazny, 1981 ), Indonesia ( Maluku ), New Guinea , New Britain, New Ireland, Solomon Isl., Australia ( Northern Territory ).

Diagnosis.
Dichotropis amboinensis
is characterized by the black mark on the forewings and the simple apical part of the male aedeagus.
